title: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park: Calendar
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Calendar            Calendar           Keyword       By Date     Start Date      End Date          Search         Upcoming Events    Showing 2 results    Show ALL instances of recurring events   RSS Feed      Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park Centennial of the National Park Service      Location: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park Fees: Free to the public     Saturday, August 27, 2016 Living historian Judd Bankert as President Woodrow Wilson will help commemorate the 100th anniversary of the National Park Service View Details      Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park Walk Through Lincoln's Life      Location: Abraham Lincoln Birthplace National Historical Park Fees: Free to the public     Wednesday, September 7, 2016 An annual educational program hosted by the park for various age school groups View Details             January:   New Year's Day - Friday, January 1 Park is closed for the holiday.   Martin Luther King, Jr. Birthday - Monday, January 18   February:   Abraham Lincoln Birthday - Friday, February 12 A wreath laying ceremony will be conducted by park staff at 10:00 A.M. EST to honor the 207th birthday of Abraham Lincoln.   March:   National Park Day - Saturday, March 26   April:   National Park Week - April 16 - 24 An annual Presidential proclaimed week for the celebration and recognition of your National Parks.   Junior Ranger Day - Saturday April 23   May:   Memorial Day - Monday, May 30 Park will go to summer schedule and be open daily from 8 A.M. until 6:45 P.M. EDT.   Interpretive programs given daily, check with information desk for times and location.   Lincoln Boyhood Home at Knob Creek will be staffed daily from 8:30 A.M. until 4:30 P.M. EDT   July:   Independence Day - Monday, July 4.  The park will host a day event beginning at 9:00 A.M. EDT with living historian Joe Wiegand as President Theodore Roosevelt at the park and an evening event at the Historic State Theater in Elizabethtown, Kentucky at 6:30 P.M. EDT.    The park will host a weekend event to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the park's existence.  Living historians portraying four Presidents - Theodore Roosevelt, William H. Taft, Franklin D. Roosevelt and Dwight D. Eisenhower - who visited the park in the past as well as Abraham Lincoln and Lincoln Farm Association Board member Samuel Clemens will be in attendance.  Events will be held throughout the weekend with a special anniversary ceremony and celebration will be held on Saturday, July 16.  Event to mark the centennial of the park - Saturday and Sunday, July 16 and 17. Main event on Saturday at 1:00 P.M. EDT    August:    Founders Day - Thursday, August 25 The National Park Service was created on this date in 1916.  Founders Day is an opportunity for parks to show our pride, connect with our visitors, and reflect on the importance of the National Park Service mission.   The park will host an event to observe the 100th anniversary of the National Park Service.  Living historian portraying President Woodrow Wilson, who signed the Organic Act that created the National Park Service, and the park's Enabling Legislation will be on hand to meet and talk with visitors.  Re-enactment of the signing of the park's Enabling Legislation and Organic Act will be held beginning at 2:00 P.M. EST.  Event to mark the centennial of the National Park Service - Saturday and Sunday, August 27 and 28. Main event on Saturday at 2:00 P.M. EDT   September:   Labor Day - Monday, September 5 Park will go to winter schedule and be open daily from 8 A.M. until 4:45 P.M. EDT.   Walk Through Lincoln's Life - September 7 and 8 An educational curriculum based event for school children and adults. The public is invited.   U. S. Constitution Week - Monday, September 12 Marks the anniversary of the U. S. Constitution being written, signed, and approved in 1787.   Public Lands Day - Saturday, September 26 Is the nation's largest hands-on volunteer effort to improve and enhance the public lands that Americans enjoy.   November:   Veterans Day - Friday, November 11   Thanksgiving Day - Thursday, November 24 Park is closed for the holiday.   December:    Christmas Day - Sunday, December 25 Park is closed for the holiday.    Note:   All events listed will take place at the Birthplace Unit on US 31E three miles south of Hodgenville, KY.  The park operates on Eastern Time.   The Boyhood Home Unit at Knob Creek is located on US 31E six miles north of Hodgenville, KY.   For additional information call (270) 358-3137.
